page.title: 18HAND MADE BRICKS (MARKS TEY)
page.content: {W.H.Collier}have been making bricks at Marks Tey since{1863.}The bricks are very special because they are all hand made.They started making bricks here because there is the right kind of clay and it is in a deep layer.The pit is{70}feet deep.Mr.Catchpole(The director)says he expects the clay to last until the beginning of the next century.By adding{20%}sand to the mixture they can make the clay last even longer. All sorts of bricks are made and some have strange names like bullnose, cants, squints, birds mouthes and saddleback. The clay is put into wooden (beech) moulds and then put on racks to dry for 10 days. The unbaked bricks are called green bricks. They are put in a tunnel kiln which takes 30 carts each of 400 to 600 bricks.They are fired at 1040 d.C. 3 million bricks are made each year.
